title: Aural set, Symph no. 40 - 1st phrase chord prog

content.description: You will hear an excerpt consisting of two phrases from a symphony. The first phrase of the excerpt will be played twice. Then the second phrase will be played twice. Finally, the entire excerpt will be played once. Before listening to each phrase, please read the questions.
content.question: Which of the following represents the chord progression played in the first phrase?

choices.label: The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are: minor one, (a long space) a minor two half diminished dominant in third inversion, a Major five dominant in one inversion, Major five dominant in root position and minor one.

The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are:  minor one, minor two diminished, minor fourth, minor two half diminished dominant in third inversion, minor one, Major five dominant in one inversion, Major five dominant in root position, minor one.
The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are: minor one, Major five, minor one, Major five, minor one, minor one in second inversion, Major five dominant in root position, minor one.

The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are: Minor one, a long space, Major five, minor one, minor four, major five dominant in first inversion, major five dominant in root position, minor one.

content.answer: The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are: minor one, (a long space) a minor two half diminished dominant in third inversion, a Major five dominant in one inversion, Major five dominant in root position and minor one.
